name: Biobot Analytics
headline: Population health analytics powered by wastewater.
description:
Biobot Analytics develops cutting-edge technology to transform sewers into public health observatories. Wastewater contains valuable information about the health of communities. We collect it. We analyze it. We tell you how to leverage it to make your city better.

Our first product is to measure opioids and other drug metabolites in sewage to estimate consumption in cities. With this data, those working on harm reduction can assess the scope of the epidemic, allocate resources, and gauge the effectiveness of programming over time.

# Harness the power of wastewater intelligence
We analyze sewage with molecular technologies and AI to provide early warning of population health threats across the globe.
[Explore our data](http://biobot.io/</data>)
#### We believe in the value of good data.
At Biobot, we’re harnessing the power of wastewater to predict disease clusters and outbreaks, optimize healthcare resources, and fuel breakthroughs in disease treatment. It’s all possible with good data – data that’s comparable across time and location – thanks to our robust methods and years of expertise.
Born at MIT, we’ve spent over a decade looking at wastewater as a measure for population health. We analyze wastewater to track the spread of respiratory illnesses like COVID-19, influenza, and RSV in real-time and on a national scale. We also monitor high-risk drug use, enabling effective and proactive harm reduction strategies and the prediction of potential overdose events.
Biobot’s data is more than just a snapshot. It’s a validated early warning system, proven to predict hospitalizations and pinpoint areas where healthcare resources are most needed. Researchers leverage our cutting-edge insights to develop new treatments, while public health officials strategically allocate resources based on our real-time data. Wastewater’s potential is vast, offering a reliable and predictive indicator of population health trends across a wide range of threats.

## **Wastewater data is the new frontier to understand population health outcomes**
![](https://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/first-icon-150x150-1.png)
###### Representative
Wastewater data represents all members of a community that contribute to a sewage system, regardless of healthcare access.
![](https://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/second-icon-150x150-1.png)
###### Timely
[Analyses published](http://biobot.io/<https:/www.sciencedirect.com/science/article/pii/S0048969721051962>) in peer-reviewed scientific journals have shown that Biobot’s wastewater data can detect viral surges in wastewater up to two full weeks before hospital admissions spike.
![](https://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/covid-icon-150x150-1.png)
###### Accurate
Our SARS-CoV-2 data is [strongly-correlated with COVID-19 cases.](http://biobot.io/<https:/pubs.acs.org/doi/pdf/10.1021/acsestwater.1c00434>) Our [SARS-CoV-2 sequencing data from wastewater](http://biobot.io/</data>) matches closely with clinical sequencing data.
## **The Biobot data advantage**
Biobot’s data insights are industry leading (read more about it in [Nature](http://biobot.io/<https:/www.nature.com/articles/s41467-023-40305-x>)). We were the first company to commercialize wastewater-based epidemiology technology, and our foundations draw back to award-winning research at MIT. In 2021, Biobot was selected by the U.S. government to launch the first nationwide wastewater program for disease tracking, the CDC National Wastewater Surveillance System (NWSS).
##### Our data complements critical population health data sources
![](https://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/biob-logo.jpg)| **Publicly AvailableWastewater Data**| **Publicly AvailableHospitalization Data**| **Clinical PatientData**  
---|---|---|---  
**Inclusive of entire communities, not just those seeking medical care**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)  
**Data comparability across entire U.S. and over periods of time**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)**Facilitated by a single data collection & analysis method**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)**Aggregates data from different labs using a variety of sample types, collection methods, and data analysis methods**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check-yellow.png)**Many disease areas do not require mandatory reporting of case data by providers**  
**Data is timely and predictive of health trends**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check-yellow.png)  
**Single data source across viral disease areas and substance use disorder**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)  
**Data interpretation & epidemiology support**| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/check.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)| ![](http://biobot.io/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/x.png)  
[Preview our data](http://biobot.io/</data>)
#### Unlock the Power of Wastewater Data
Gain early warnings on outbreaks, inform resource allocation, track population health trends, and understand community disease burden. See our data in action by requesting a demo below.
[Request a demo](http://biobot.io/</get-started>)

generated_description:
### Biobot Analytics Overview

**Company Name:** Biobot Analytics  
**Founded:** 2018  
**Location:** Cambridge, MA  
**Batch:** Y Combinator W18  
**Team Size:** 17 employees  
**Group Partner:** Michael Seibel  

**Website:** [biobot.io](http://biobot.io)

#### Mission
Biobot Analytics aims to harness the unseen potential of wastewater to improve population health. They have revolutionized the way we perceive sewage, transforming it into a powerful tool for public health observatories. Their data-driven insights aim to help cities enhance public wellbeing by analyzing the health information embedded in wastewater. 

#### What They Do
Biobot develops advanced technology to analyze sewage for valuable health data. Their primary focus is measuring opioids and other drug metabolites in wastewater to estimate usage patterns in cities. This data enables organizations working on harm reduction to better understand the epidemic, allocate resources effectively, and monitor the impact of their programs over time. 

The company has also expanded its offerings to include tracking respiratory illnesses like COVID-19 and flu in real-time nationwide. By analyzing wastewater, they provide early warnings about potential outbreaks and health threats, allowing healthcare systems to respond proactively.

#### Key Products and Services
1. **Wastewater-Based Epidemiology**: Biobot analyzes sewage to track and predict disease spread, enabling public health officials to allocate resources where they are needed most.
2. **Real-Time Monitoring**: Their system provides early warnings of viral activity, often weeks before hospital admissions reflect the increase in cases.
3. **Opioid Usage Insights**: By measuring drug-related substances in sewage, they inform harm reduction strategies.

#### The Biobot Advantage
- **Inclusivity**: Wastewater data captures information from the entire community, regardless of individual healthcare access.
- **Timeliness**: Their data can detect health trends days to weeks before traditional clinical data.
- **Accuracy**: Their findings are validated against clinical data, ensuring reliability.

#### Recognition
Biobot Analytics was the first company to commercialize wastewater-based health tracking technology, rooted in MIT research. In 2021, they were selected by the U.S. government to establish the CDC National Wastewater Surveillance System, a groundbreaking initiative for comprehensive disease tracking.

#### Future Direction
As they continue to innovate, Biobot Analytics aims to further establish wastewater as a crucial tool in public health research and response, offering cities greater insights and enabling proactive measures to enhance community health.

In short, if you’re looking to leverage the unseen data present in our daily lives—even in what we often consider waste—Biobot Analytics is leading the charge to turn that data into actionable insights for better health outcomes.
